commitResults.messageBody: Branch create help guide
Update name in AboutUs Page

- Added the main method to start the application
- Displayed welcome message to the user
- Captured user input for commands and executed them
- Included loop to continue processing commands until exit command is
received
- Displayed exit message before terminating the application

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Parser class to Implement command parsing logic
commitResults.messageBody:
This structure allows the application to process user commands
effectively and respond with appropriate actions or errors.

By delegating command handling to specific command classes and
validators, the design adheres to the Single Responsibility Principle,
enhancing maintainability and scalability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Transaction class to represent financial transactions
commitResults.messageBody:
The Transaction class will be inherited by the Expense and Income class

The Transaction class encapsulate transaction details such as
description, amount, and date.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Ui class for user interface methods while using BudgetBuddy
commitResults.messageBody:
The Ui class will retrieve commands, display messages, and acknowledge
transaction updates.

This implementation enhances user experience by ensuring consistent text
 formatting and alignment

This Commands that will be inherited by other Command sub-classes
for executing user commands

This design allows for future command implementations to inherit from
the Command class, promoting code reuse and adherence to object-oriented
 principles.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Category enum for Income class
commitResults.messageBody: The Category enum helps to classify expense categories

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Expense and Income class to represent financial expenses
commitResults.messageBody:
The Expense class, inherits from the Transaction class to include a
category attribute

This design promotes clear organization of expense data and provides a
 comprehensive representation of each expense or income entry.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement ExpenseManager and IncomeManager class for managing expenses and incomes transactions respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
The ExpenseManager / IncomeManager class help to facilitate adding,
deleting, and listing expenses, along with maintaining the count of
expenses

This structure enhances organization and provides a straightforward
interface for managing expenses or incomes transaction

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ExitCommand class to support application exit functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The class is empty because the ExitCommand class is necessary for the
main code to run. The exit function will be coded by other teammates

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AddExpenseValidator and AddIncomeValidator for validating add expense and add income commands respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
The AddExpenseValidator and AddIncomeValidator class helps to parse and
validate user commands for adding expenses or income, ensuring that all
required fields are correctly formatted

The 2 add classes will create and return addExpenseCommand or
addIncomeCommand if the input is validAn A invalidCommand will be
created which will provide informative error messages for invalid inputs

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AddExpenseCommand and AddIncomeCommand for adding expenses and incomes respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's create the AddExpenseCommand class to encapsulate the details of
an expense and execute the addition of the expense to the ExpenseManager

commitResults.messageTitle: Add IncorrectCommand class for handling invalid commands
commitResults.messageBody:
The IncorrectCommand class encapsulates feedback for the user regarding
specific command errors and execute the display of this feedback

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ExpenseIndexValidator and IncomeIndexValidator for validating expense and income indices
commitResults.messageBody:
The ExpenseIndexValidator and IncomeIndexValidator class check if the
provided index is a valid integer and falls within the range of existing
expenses or incomes count

commitResults.messageTitle: Add DeleteExpenseValidator and DeleteIncomeValidator for validating delete expense and income commands respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
The DeleteExpenseValidator and DeleteIncomeValidator class parse and
validate user input for deleting expenses or income, ensuring that the
provided index is valid.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add DeleteExpenseCommand and DeleteIncomeCommand classes for removing expenses and income respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
The DeleteExpenseCommand class encapsulate the index of the
expense/income to be deleted and execute the deletion through the
ExpenseManager/IncomeManager.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ListExpenseCommand and ListIncomeCommand for displaying expenses and income respectively
commitResults.messageBody:
The ListExpenseCommand/ListIncomeCommand class to encapsulate the
functionality for retrieving and displaying the list of expenses/incomes
 through the ExpenseManager/IncomeManager.
Moved the displayExitMessage function to ExitCommand class
